snippet: Mr. Lomax, a World War II British prisoner who was tortured by the Japanese and later forgave one of his tormentors, wrote the best-selling memoir, “The Railway Man.”
abstract: Eric Lomax, British POW during World War II who later forgave his Japanese torturer and wrote best-selling memoir The Railway Man, dies at age 93.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Lomax, a World War II British prisoner who was tortured by the Japanese and later forgave one of his tormentors, wrote the best-selling memoir, “The Railway Man.”
